title: Psalms Chapter 36 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 36 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 36 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 36.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:1, what does the transgression of the wicked say within the psalmist's heart?
options: There is no fear of God before his eyes
questions.correctAnswer: There is no fear of God before his eyes
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:1 states that the transgression of the wicked saith within the heart that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

questions.question: What does the wicked person do according to Psalms 36:2?
options: Flattereth himself in his own eyes
questions.correctAnswer: Flattereth himself in his own eyes
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:2 says the wicked flatter themselves in their own eyes until their iniquity is found to be hateful.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:3, what are the words of the wicked person's mouth?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:3 describes the words of the wicked's mouth as iniquity and deceit.

questions.question: Where does the wicked devise mischief according to Psalms 36:4?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:4 states that the wicked deviseth mischief upon his bed.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:5, where is the mercy of the LORD said to be?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:5 declares that the mercy of the LORD is in the heavens.

questions.question: How is God's righteousness described in Psalms 36:6?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:6 compares God's righteousness to the great mountains.

questions.question: Who does the LORD preserve according to Psalms 36:6?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:6 says the LORD preserveth man and beast.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:7, where do the children of men put their trust?
options: Under the shadow of God's wings
questions.correctAnswer: Under the shadow of God's wings
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:7 states that children of men put their trust under the shadow of God's wings.

questions.question: What shall they be abundantly satisfied with according to Psalms 36:8?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:8 says they shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of God's house.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:9, what is with God?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:9 declares that with God is the fountain of life.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 36:10 asks God to continue His lovingkindness to those who do not know Him.
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:10 asks God to continue His lovingkindness to those that know Him, not those who do not know Him.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 36:11 requests that the foot of pride does not come against the psalmist.
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:11 asks that the foot of pride not come against the psalmist.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 36:12, the workers of iniquity will be able to rise again.
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:12 states that the workers of iniquity are cast down and shall not be able to rise.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 36:9: 'For with thee is the fountain of ______: in thy light shall we see light.'
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:9 says 'For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 36:7: 'How excellent is thy ______, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.'
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:7 states 'How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.'

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 36 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 36 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with pride and self-deception. Based on Psalms 36, what biblical truth would you share about the heart of the wicked?
options: The wicked have no fear of God before their eyes
The wicked are always humble and repentant
The wicked fear God and turn from evil
The wicked trust in God's mercy
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked have no fear of God before their eyes
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:1 teaches that the transgression of the wicked is revealed by their lack of fear of God before their eyes. This indicates pride and self-deception as described also in verses 2-4.

questions.question: How does Psalms 36 encourage us to respond to God's mercy and faithfulness in daily living?
options: By trusting under the shadow of His wings
By relying on our own wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: By trusting under the shadow of His wings
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:7 illustrates that because of God's excellent lovingkindness, people put their trust under the shadow of His wings, symbolizing protection and faith in Him.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged and feels spiritually dry. According to Psalms 36, what source can refresh and satisfy the soul?
options: The river of God's pleasures and the fatness of His house
questions.correctAnswer: The river of God's pleasures and the fatness of His house
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:8-9 explain that God’s provision satisfies abundantly and that with Him is the fountain of life, providing spiritual refreshment and light.

questions.question: What does Psalms 36 teach about the character of God's righteousness and judgments?
options: They are like great mountains and a great deep
They change according to human desires
questions.correctAnswer: They are like great mountains and a great deep
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:6 describes God's righteousness as like great mountains and His judgments as a great deep, emphasizing their strength and permanence.

questions.question: How does Psalms 36 guide believers in dealing with pride and opposition from the wicked?
options: By praying that pride and wicked hands do not prevail against them
questions.correctAnswer: By praying that pride and wicked hands do not prevail against them
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:11 asks God to prevent the foot of pride and the hand of the wicked from harming the psalmist, teaching reliance on God’s protection.

questions.question: A church leader wants to encourage faithfulness among the upright. What does Psalms 36 say God continues to show toward those who know Him?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:10 asks God to continue His lovingkindness to those who know Him and His righteousness to the upright in heart, highlighting ongoing divine faithfulness.

questions.question: What practical lesson about honesty and speech can we learn from Psalms 36 regarding the wicked’s words?
options: Their words are iniquity and deceit
Their words are wise and encouraging
questions.correctAnswer: Their words are iniquity and deceit
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:3 states that the wicked's mouth speaks iniquity and deceit, warning believers to be discerning about speech and integrity.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 36, God preserves both man and beast by His righteous judgments.
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:6 affirms that God preserves man and beast, indicating His care for all creation through His righteous judgments.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 36 teaches that workers of iniquity will ultimately be unable to rise after falling.
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:12 states that the workers of iniquity have fallen and shall not be able to rise, illustrating the consequences of persistent wickedness.

questions.question: In Psalms 36, the wicked devise mischief in what setting, showing their constant planning of evil?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:4 says the wicked devise mischief upon their bed, revealing their continual plotting even in private moments.

questions.question: How can believers practically apply Psalms 36's teaching on God's 'fountain of life' in their daily walk?
options: By seeking God's presence as the source of true life and light
By relying solely on human wisdom for guidance
By ignoring God's word and focusing on material gain
By withdrawing from community and fellowship
questions.correctAnswer: By seeking God's presence as the source of true life and light
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:9 describes God as the fountain of life and the source of light, encouraging believers to depend on Him daily for spiritual vitality.

questions.question: A parent desires to teach their child about the nature of evil according to Psalms 36. What truth should they emphasize?
options: The wicked do not abhor evil and set themselves in ways that are not good
The wicked are quick to repent and seek wisdom
The wicked always fear God and turn from sin
The wicked speak only truth and kindness
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked do not abhor evil and set themselves in ways that are not good
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:4 teaches that the wicked do not abhor evil, and they set themselves on paths that are not good, highlighting the nature of persistent sinfulness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 36 illustrate the relationship between God's lovingkindness and human trust?
options: Because of God's lovingkindness, people trust under His wings
God's lovingkindness causes people to fear and distrust
God's lovingkindness is irrelevant to human trust
People trust themselves more than God's lovingkindness
questions.correctAnswer: Because of God's lovingkindness, people trust under His wings
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:7 clearly shows that God's lovingkindness encourages trust from people who find refuge under His protection symbolized by His wings.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'They shall be abundantly satisfied with the ______ of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.'
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:8 uses the term 'fatness' of God's house to describe abundant satisfaction and blessing provided by God.

questions.question: What practical advice does Psalms 36 offer for those facing temptation and the influence of the wicked?
options: Seek God's protection so pride and wickedness do not harm
Give in to temptation to avoid conflict
Ignore God and trust in personal strength
questions.correctAnswer: Seek God's protection so pride and wickedness do not harm
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:11 encourages prayer for God’s protection from the foot of pride and the hand of the wicked, teaching reliance on God during trials.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 36 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 36.

questions.question: In Psalms 36:1, what does the transgression of the wicked reveal within the psalmist's heart?
options: There is no fear of God before his eyes
He is full of mercy and truth
questions.correctAnswer: There is no fear of God before his eyes
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:1 states that the transgression of the wicked reveals that there is no fear of God before his eyes, highlighting the moral blindness of the wicked.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:5, how is the LORD's mercy described in relation to the heavens?
options: Thy mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens
Thy mercy is hidden beneath the earth
Thy mercy is as fleeting as the morning dew
questions.correctAnswer: Thy mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:5 uses a metaphor placing God's mercy in the heavens, emphasizing its vastness and exalted nature.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Psalms 36:6 to describe God's righteousness and judgments?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:6 uses similes comparing God's righteousness to great mountains and His judgments to a great deep, illustrating their immensity and stability.

questions.question: In Psalms 36:7, what imagery is used to describe the protection offered by God’s lovingkindness?
questions.explanation: The verse uses the image of sheltering under God's wings, a common ancient Near Eastern symbol of divine protection and care.

questions.question: Which phrase from Psalms 36:9 signifies the source of life and illumination?
options: For with thee is the fountain of life
questions.correctAnswer: For with thee is the fountain of life
questions.explanation: This phrase metaphorically links God as the source of life, connecting with the biblical theme of God as light and life.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:3, what two negative qualities are found in the words of the wicked?
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states the wicked speak words that are iniquity and deceit, emphasizing their moral corruption.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew word translated as 'lovingkindness' in Psalms 36:7 (חֶסֶד, chesed) primarily convey in ancient Near Eastern context?
questions.explanation: The Hebrew word 'chesed' reflects God's faithful covenant love, a key theological theme that runs throughout the Old Testament.

questions.question: How does Psalms 36:12 portray the fate of the workers of iniquity in a way that aligns with Proverbs’ wisdom themes?
options: They are exalted by the people
questions.explanation: The imagery of the wicked falling and being unable to rise parallels Proverbs’ frequent warnings about the downfall of the wicked due to their own actions.

questions.question: In Psalms 36:10, what two qualities does the psalmist ask God to continue toward those who know Him?
questions.explanation: The verse requests God’s continued lovingkindness and righteousness, emphasizing the covenantal relationship between God and the faithful.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'in thy light shall we see light' in Psalms 36:9 with respect to biblical theology of revelation?
options: God’s light reveals truth and grants spiritual understanding
Light refers only to physical daylight
Light is a symbol of judgment
questions.correctAnswer: God’s light reveals truth and grants spiritual understanding
questions.explanation: This phrase reflects the biblical theme that God’s presence and revelation bring knowledge and insight, echoing themes found in John 1:4-5.

questions.question: How does the psalmist describe the behavior of the wicked in Psalms 36:4?
options: He devises mischief upon his bed and abhors not evil
He honors the LORD with his life
questions.correctAnswer: He devises mischief upon his bed and abhors not evil
questions.explanation: The verse underscores the deliberate and persistent nature of wickedness, planned even in private moments, showing deep moral corruption.

questions.question: What does Psalms 36:8 metaphorically refer to as 'the fatness of thy house'?
options: The abundant blessings and provision from God
questions.correctAnswer: The abundant blessings and provision from God
questions.explanation: The 'fatness' signifies abundance and richness, symbolizing God's generous provision for those who trust in Him.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 36:11, the psalmist asks God to prevent the hand of the wicked from removing him.
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:11 explicitly prays that the hand of the wicked will not remove the psalmist, indicating a plea for protection from evil.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:2, until when does the wicked flatter himself in his own eyes?
options: Until his iniquity be found to be hateful
questions.correctAnswer: Until his iniquity be found to be hateful
questions.explanation: The verse describes the self-deception of the wicked persisting until their sin becomes abhorrent, highlighting self-delusion as a theme.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'the river of thy pleasures' in Psalms 36:8 within ancient Near Eastern imagery?
options: It symbolizes abundant divine blessings and joy
It refers to a literal river near Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes abundant divine blessings and joy
questions.explanation: Rivers often symbolize life and blessing in ancient Near Eastern literature; here it represents the joy and satisfaction found in God’s provision.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 36 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 36 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:1, what does the wicked person lack before the eyes of God?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:1 states that the transgression of the wicked reveals there is no fear of God before his eyes. This reflects a fundamental biblical theme that true wisdom begins with the fear of the Lord (Proverbs 1:7, Ecclesiastes 12:13, Isaiah 11:2-3, Hebrews 12:28).

questions.question: What does the wicked person do according to Psalms 36:2 until his sin is found to be hateful?
options: Flattereth himself in his own eyes
Hides his sins from the community
questions.correctAnswer: Flattereth himself in his own eyes
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:2 describes the wicked as flattering themselves in their own eyes until their iniquity becomes hateful. This self-deception is consistent with biblical warnings against pride and self-righteousness (Proverbs 16:18, Romans 1:21-22, 2 Timothy 3:2-4, James 4:6).

questions.question: In Psalms 36:3, the words of the wicked's mouth are described as what?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:3 states the wicked's words are filled with iniquity and deceit, indicating a heart hardened against righteousness. This matches biblical teaching on the corrupt nature of sin and falsehood (Jeremiah 9:5, Romans 3:13, Ephesians 4:25, Colossians 3:9).

questions.question: What does the wicked person devise upon his bed as stated in Psalms 36:4?
questions.explanation: According to Psalms 36:4, the wicked devises mischief upon his bed, showing the depth of their sinful intent. This aligns with biblical descriptions of the human heart as deceitful and inclined toward evil (Jeremiah 17:9, Genesis 6:5, Proverbs 6:18, Romans 7:18).

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:5, where is God's mercy said to be?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:5 declares that God's mercy is in the heavens, highlighting His transcendent and infinite kindness. This reflects the biblical portrayal of God's mercy as vast and unsearchable (Psalm 103:11, Lamentations 3:22, Ephesians 2:4, Titus 3:5).

questions.question: How does Psalms 36:6 describe God's righteousness?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:6 compares God's righteousness to great mountains, symbolizing strength, stability, and immovability. This metaphor appears throughout Scripture to emphasize God's justice and faithfulness (Isaiah 54:10, Psalm 125:1, Habakkuk 2:4, Romans 3:26).

questions.question: What do the children of men do under God's wings according to Psalms 36:7?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:7 says that the children of men put their trust under the shadow of God's wings, signifying refuge and protection. This imagery is used in several biblical passages to depict God's care for His people (Ruth 2:12, Psalm 91:4, Matthew 23:37, Hebrews 6:18).

questions.question: Psalms 36:8 states that those who trust in God will be abundantly satisfied with what?
questions.explanation: The verse promises abundant satisfaction with the fatness of God's house, symbolizing spiritual nourishment and blessing. This aligns with biblical themes of God providing abundantly for His people (Psalm 23:5, Isaiah 55:1-2, John 6:35, Philippians 4:19).

questions.question: What is described as the 'fountain of life' in Psalms 36:9?
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:9 declares that with God is the fountain of life, emphasizing that true life and vitality come from Him alone. This concept is echoed in John 4:14, John 7:38, Jeremiah 2:13, and Revelation 22:1-2.

questions.question: According to Psalms 36:10, to whom should God continue His lovingkindness and righteousness?
options: To them that know Him and the upright in heart
Only to the priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: To them that know Him and the upright in heart
questions.explanation: The verse specifically asks God to continue His lovingkindness to those who know Him and are upright in heart, highlighting the covenantal and moral relationship with God (Psalm 25:14, Proverbs 3:3-4, John 8:32, 2 Timothy 2:22).

questions.question: What does Psalms 36:11 request God to prevent from coming against the psalmist?
options: The foot of pride and the hand of the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: The foot of pride and the hand of the wicked
questions.explanation: The psalmist petitions God not to allow the foot of pride or the hand of the wicked to harm him. This reflects biblical teaching about pride as a precursor to downfall (Proverbs 16:18) and the protection God provides against evil (Psalm 34:7, 1 Peter 5:8, James 4:6).

questions.question: What fate awaits the workers of iniquity according to Psalms 36:12?
options: They have fallen and cannot rise
They will be forgiven if they repent
They will prosper for a time
They will be hidden from judgment
questions.correctAnswer: They have fallen and cannot rise
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:12 warns that workers of iniquity are cast down and shall not be able to rise, illustrating the finality of divine judgment. This is consistent with other scriptures on the ultimate defeat of evil (Proverbs 24:16, Isaiah 14:15, Matthew 25:41, Revelation 20:10).

questions.question: How does Psalms 36 portray the contrast between God's attributes and the wicked's character?
options: God's mercy and righteousness vs. wickedness and deceit
God's silence vs. the wicked's loudness
God's wrath vs. the wicked's peace
God's absence vs. the wicked's presence
questions.correctAnswer: God's mercy and righteousness vs. wickedness and deceit
questions.explanation: The psalm contrasts God's mercy, faithfulness, righteousness, and lovingkindness (verses 5-10) with the wicked's transgression, deceit, and mischief (verses 1-4). This highlights the biblical theme of God's holiness opposed to human sinfulness (Isaiah 6:3, Romans 3:23, Psalm 145:8, 1 John 1:5).

questions.question: What theological truth does Psalms 36:9 imply regarding the nature of spiritual illumination?
options: In God's light, we see light
Only prophets can see the light
questions.correctAnswer: In God's light, we see light
questions.explanation: Psalms 36:9 declares that in God's light we see light, affirming that true spiritual understanding and life come from God alone. This theological truth is echoed in John 8:12, 1 John 1:5, Ephesians 5:8, and 2 Corinthians 4:6.

questions.question: What does the metaphor of 'the shadow of thy wings' in Psalms 36:7 signify about God's relationship with believers?
questions.explanation: The metaphor of the shadow of God's wings in Psalms 36:7 symbolizes the protective care God provides His people, a common biblical image (Ruth 2:12, Psalm 91:4, Matthew 23:37, Deuteronomy 32:11). It conveys intimacy, security, and divine guardianship.
